commits.message: Changes - to review.
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/TroyShaw/troykanoid
Added ability to skip current level. Added valgrind memory leak detection scripts. Added suppresion file. Game currently does not leak according to valgrind (under the testing I have done so far).
Update README.md
First cut of converting project to use sdl2. Compiles and runs fine, although still needs to be lots of work done to make it properly use sdl2.

Update README.md

Added some screenshots.
Added performance monitoring file.
Started working on adding the gun powerup properly to the game. Added unicode typing support while entering name for highscore to properly handle caps lock/ shift.
Added performance testing code. Tidied up some stuff. Fixed a bug with getting no highscore and having to type a character before being let back to the main menu.
Fixed phantom ball memory leak (balls were being pushed out of game-play area but not below bottom of area, and hence were not being freed).

Moved some of the entity initialisation code to the game_entities files. Created the per-game reset function and used it in the game file. Fixed the bug with crashing post-game on the enter-score screen. Game is now actually playable.
Lots of changes. Blocks now sort-of work, and levels can sort-of progress, but still in progress.
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/TroyShaw/troykanoid
Began conversion of the blocks to using chipmunk.

Update README.md

Updated the README to be current, including the dependency, build, and running information.
Added proper block images. Altered the HUD to display lives as balls instead of numbers.
Updated coordinate file.
Added some proper fonts. Added a background image.
Got image-based rendering of the paddle and ball working properly. Added the ball image.
Added the paddle images and started integrating them into the project.
Lots of changes. Moved to the Chipmunk physics engine. Began porting all code. Currently the ball, paddles and wall use the library. Need to convert over powerups and blocks.
Big cleanup of main game files.
Changed back to GCC. Got rid of all GCC's warnings.
Lots of refactoring. Refactored the powerup system. Fixed bug with ball multiply not working.
Lots of refactorings. Uncommented out the powerups code. Got rid of all compile warnings.
Lots of refactoring.
Refactored the highscore files.
More refactoring.
Refactoring until it compiles again.
Mostly converted the game to using SDL.
Began conversion to SDL. Got rid of all compile warnings.
Modified makefile to generic one. Moved the header files to the src directory.
Migrated project to Linux. Fixed a lot of bugs in code.
Created header directory and moved files there.
Added a new centerPrint() function which prints stuff centered on x axis. Used to simplify code in a few places.
added code to check if window has been closed (via glError() function) and then exit the process
added a sleep function to the main loop to conserve cpu. Pretty primitive but functions perfectly
added the draw/fill circle functions
tidied up code. Changed render functions from accepting ints to floats. You can now push q to quit while paused
added seperate physics file and integrated it into game
added drawLine() function instead of using gl calls in render code for consistency
forced doubled balls to shoot upwards always
updated documentation for renderer
tidied up main render code a lot. redesigned table format
fixed blinking curser to not flash when typing
created powerups.c/h and moved powerup code there
using old collision detection code for testing purposes until new code is fixed properly
updated number of levels constant
added the levels folder which includes all the levels
updated .gitignore to include a planning folder
added nice flashing curser as you type, as well as a define for flash rate in renderer.h
tidied up levels.c
fixed render code for postgame screen to display users name as they type
added code to use new typing system after getting a highscore
added typing capabilities to highscore system for user to enter their name after getting a highscore
added sticky paddle macros to pong.h
updated includes
added documentation to the enterScore() function
added in an initializer to the rand() function so that values are different on different runs
changed powerups to drop from blocks instead of at random. Changed probability to 20% of the time
added post menu render code and used the switch statements with the GameMode enum
Added gamemode enum. Need to use it throughout game though.
added meteor powerup
added in a life powerup to give +1 lives to player
added more level code. Now transitions (not finished) between levels and quits the game after the final level. Also loads the levels from disc now too.
fixed a small bug drawing the forcefield with length and width inverted. Was also doing outline, not fill.
converted struct variables to points to structs
small tidy ups here and there
updated .gitignore with levels/
Update README.md
level generation code basically finished
cleaned up
cleaned up main
refactored
added more level code to populate the block array
refactored by adding fill/drawRect() and used them
misc updates mostly to do with the level system
added the levels.c/h files which populate levels
ball doubling code seems to work properly
added ball doubling logic into powerup function
removed some superfluous functions
added readme file
fixed more bugs with file and highscore system
added code to read files, fixing bugs
added some file logic into highscore
added a small fix with holding spacebar on death. Added some more highscore code
added some more highscore render stuff to renderer.c
added the highscore system
added highscore table render code
removed main.cpp, it got created somehow
added the readme file
initial commit
